div.p: School... Junior School or Primary School was OK, it was difficult; my father died when I was 9 and that left a massive hole in my life really
and then I went to Senior School my mum got married again when I was about 11 or 12, I went to big school, Secondary School, was mucking about
all the time really and I wish I’d applied myself a lot more and I wasn’t stupid by any stretch of the imagination and walked out of school with
3 O-Levels, I was passionate about history and I still love history and geography and got O-Levels in those subjects and stuff
but I didn’t try and I was lucky I had a good memory and could retain knowledge and stuff but I should have applied myself more in
maths and stuff and all the rest of it instead of mucking about and trying to be Jack the Lad which I did; I did come out of school with
some good grades but it could have been so much better. I had a geography teacher called Mr Graham who was very good, he knew
what my background was and all the rest of it and said that sort of, I guess he became a bit of a father figure really,
I had a bit of a talent for geography and history and stuff and he told me that I was good enough to do CSE but he was going to enter me
for O-Level and he said if I did apply myself in those subjects that I would pass and, you know, he used to take a bit of extra care and
check my homework twice and made sure I did it and goodness knows what and I did pass those two subjects, you know, and
I think, yeah, he was a nice man...
